means: 做决定，分解(resolve的过去式和过去分词)

sentence.Network_en: Until the matter is resolved the athletes will be ineligible to compete.
sentence.Network_cn: 除非这个问题得以解决，否则这些运动员没有资格参加比赛。

sentence.Network_en: The US military expects the matter to be resolved peacefully.
sentence.Network_cn: 美国军方期待该事件得到和平解决。

sentence.Network_en: She resolved to report the matter to the hospital's nursing manager.
sentence.Network_cn: 她决定把这件事汇报给医院的护士长。

entry.def: If you are resolved to do something, you are determined to do it.

example.ex: Barnes was resolved to moving on when his contract expired.
example.tran: 合同到期以后，巴恩斯决定做点别的。

sentences.sentence: "she was firmly resolved to be a doctor"
"single-minded in his determination to stop smoking"
"mysteries solved and unsolved; problems resolved and unresolved"

auth_sentence.content: The territorial and boundary dispute has not been resolved.
auth_sentence.res_content: The territorial and boundary dispute has not been resolved.
auth_sentence.res_content_con: The territorial and boundary dispute has not been resolved.

auth_sentence.content: This contradiction cannot be resolved in classical space.
auth_sentence.res_content: This contradiction cannot be resolved in classical space.
auth_sentence.res_content_con: This contradiction cannot be resolved in classical space.

auth_sentence.content: Other Scruggs money fights were not as easily resolved.
auth_sentence.res_content: Other Scruggs money fights were not as easily resolved.
auth_sentence.res_content_con: Other Scruggs money fights were not as easily resolved.

Sentence.sentence: Disputes were characterized by intense verbal ( 言语上的) aggression, tended to be repeated and not resolved and made men, more than women, extremely angry.
resolved to stop selling oil to the United States.
